Pancaroba, Waspada Demam Berdarah!
03 Nov 2019, 07:41 by Ririn Nur Febriani
CIMAHI, (PR).- Dinas Kesehatan (Dinkes) Kota Cimahi mengingatkan masyarakat untuk waspada gangguan kesehatan pada musim peralihan dari musim kemarau ke musim hujan. Terutama, mewaspadai penyakit Demam Berdarah Dangue (DBD), tren penyakit yang disebarkan nyamuk aedes aegypti itu biasanya meningkat saat musim pancaroba.
Kepala Dinkes Kota Cimahi drg. Pratiwi mengatakan, untuk mencegah kasus DBD memasuki musim peralihan dari kemarau ke hujan yang paling tepat adalah dengan Pemberantasan Sarang Nyamuk (PSN) dengan gerakan 3 M, yakni menguras, menutup dan mengubur.
"Lakukan pencegahan dengan PSN," ujarnya. Sebab, pertumbuhan nyamuk DBD Â bisa terjadi di tiap genangan air.
"Yang penting menjaga kebersihan lingkungan masing-masing, katanya.
Berdasarkan kasus DBD tahun lalu, trennya mengalami peningkatan saat memasuki musim pancaroba. Puncaknya terjadi pada awal tahun 2019 atau saat musim hujan dengan kasus DBD Januari mencapai 349 kasus. Sedangkan, sepanjang Januari-September 2019 data kasus DBD mencapai 873 kasus.
Sebagai upaya pencegahan lainnya, Dinkes Kota Cimahi menyarankan masyarakat menanam tanaman yang bisa mengusir nyamuk seperti bunga lavender, daun siri dan daun mint. Sebab, tanaman-tanaman tersebut diyakini bisa mengusir nyamuk penyebar virus dengue.
"Kita anjurkan menanam tanaman yang bisa mengusir nyamuk. Contoh bunga lavender, daun siri, daun mint," katanya.
Pihaknya juga sudah menyediakan abate yang bisa didapatkan masyarakat di 13 Pusat Kesehatan Masyarakat (Puskesmas) se-Kota Cimahi secara gratis. "Gratis, tinggal ambil di Puskesmas," ucapnya.
Kepala Seksi Pengendalian dan Pemberantasan Penyakit Menular Romi Abdurakhman didampingi staff Eka Febriana mengatakan, peningkatan kasus DBD biasanya akibat banyaknya genangan air yang tidak terperhatikan oleh masyarakat sehingga menjadi media untuk tumbuhnya populasi nyamuk.
"Mau musim hujan banyak genangan air, di situ banyak nyamuk baru dan populasi nyamuk meningkat," katanya.
Untuk mencegah peningkatan kasus DBD, lanjutnya, pihaknya mulai melakukan persiapan. Seperti terus menggalakan Pemberantasan Sarang Nyamuk (PSN). "Kalau pencegahan pasti dilakukan sebelum penularan. Dari mulai sekarang digiatkan lagi PSN," ujarnya.
Pihaknya sudah memiliki konsep baru dalam melakukan PSN, yakni dengan dengan membentuk kader Juru Pemantau Jentik (Jumantik) di setiap rumah. Kadernya dari salah satu anggota keluarga di setiap rumah.
"Strateginya kita minta ke Puskesmas buat percontohan. Setiap kelurahan satu RW dulu jadi percontohan. Nanti kita evaluasi," katanya.***

Transmission, Beware of Dengue Fever!
03 Nov 2019, 07:41 by Ririn Nur Febriani
CIMAHI, (PR) .- The Health Office (DHO) of Cimahi City reminds the public to be aware of health problems in the transition season from the dry season to the rainy season. Especially, being aware of Dangue Hemorrhagic Fever (DHF), the trend of diseases spread by the Aedes aegypti mosquito usually increases during the transition season.
Head of Cimahi City Health Office, drg. Pratiwi said, to prevent dengue cases from entering the transition season from drought to rain, the most appropriate is to eradicate mosquito nests (PSN) with a 3 M movement, which is draining, closing and burying.
"Take precautions with PSN," he said. Because, the growth of DHF mosquitoes can occur in each pool of water.
"The important thing is to maintain the cleanliness of each environment," he said.
Based on the DHF case last year, the trend has increased when entering the transition season. The peak occurred in early 2019 or during the rainy season with January DHF cases reaching 349 cases. Meanwhile, during January-September 2019 DHF case data reached 873 cases.
As another preventive measure, the Cimahi City Health Office recommends the community to plant plants that can repel mosquitoes such as lavender flowers, siri leaves and mint leaves. Because these plants are believed to be able to repel mosquitoes that spread dengue virus.
"We recommend planting plants that can repel mosquitoes. Examples of lavender flowers, siri leaves, mint leaves," he said.
It also has provided abates that can be obtained by the public at 13 Community Health Centers (Puskesmas) throughout Cimahi City for free. "It's free, just take it at the health center," he said.
Head of the Control and Eradication of Communicable Diseases Romi Abdurakhman accompanied by staff Eka Febriana said, the increase in dengue cases is usually due to the large amount of standing water that is not noticed by the community so that it becomes a medium for the growth of mosquito populations.
"Want the rainy season a lot of puddles, there are a lot of new mosquitoes and mosquito population increases," he said.
To prevent an increase in dengue cases, he continued, he began to make preparations. Like continuing to promote the Eradication of Mosquito Nest (PSN). "If prevention must be carried out before transmission. From now on again PSN is activated," he said.
His party already has a new concept in conducting PSN, namely by forming cadres of larvae monitoring (Jumantik) in each house. A cadre of one family member in each house.
"The strategy is we ask the Puskesmas to make a pilot. Every neighborhood of one RW used to be a pilot. We will evaluate it later," he said. ***
